Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Regional Anesthesia in Kidney Transplant Recipients

Participants.evidence: A total of 100 adult patients undergoing deceased donor kidney transplant were included, excluding those with opioid dependence.

Intervention.evidence: Patients were divided into two groups: Group A received ultrasound-guided TAP blocks, and Group B did not.

Objective.evidence: This study evaluates the effect of transversus abdominis plane (TAP) blocks on peri-operative pain management in kidney transplant recipients.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the use of intra-operative and post-operative analgesia up to 24 hours post-surgery.

Number_Randomised.evidence: Fifty patients were included in each group.

Result_Outcome.evidence: Group A showed a statistically significant reduction in intra-operative fentanyl use (p = 0.04).

Harms.evidence: No complications were recorded from TAP block use.
